Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (CGS 3269, MAD 2104, COP 3330 and COP 3502C) or (COP 3503C and Computer Science or Computer Engineering major) all with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Client-server architecture. Server-side scripting: Servlets, JSP, PHP. JDBC and MySQL database; connectivity. Multi-threaded Java applications. J2EE development. SSL., Event-driven programming.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

CNT4704 - Analysis of Computer Communica.name: CNT4704 - Analysis of Computer Communication Networks

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (COT 3100C or MAD 2104) and STA 2023 each with grades of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Network design using layering. Introduces cabling, topology, architecture, hardware and software. Includes performance and control issues such as congestion control, error control, contention resolution.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

CNT4703C - Design and Implementation of.name: CNT4703C - Design and Implementation of Computer Communication Networks

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (CNT 3004, COP 3502C and either MAD 2104 or COT 3100C) or (COP 3503C and Computer Science major) all with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Data communication networking technologies (TCP/IP, Ethernet, Gigabit Ethernet, ATM, Frame Relay), products (routers, switches, adapters, cabling). Base design and detailed configuration including hands-on exercises.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CGS 3763 or COP 4600 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better. Administration of cloud computing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Topics include virtualization, container, resource management, programming models, application models, and system administration. Real-world Cloud Computing systems and tools, such as OpenStack, Amazon/Microsoft/Google public cloud systems, as well as Hadoop and Spark.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (CNT 3004 or EEL 4781 or CNT 4704) and (CIS 3360 or CIS 3362) all with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Fundamentals of network security, protocols, secure applications, network intrusion detection, security policy, firewalls, and privacy issues.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PHY 2053C    with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better and,

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Network media, protocol, current and evolving standards for local, metropolitan, wide area and wireless networks.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CGS 3763 or COP 3503C and Computer Science major, with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An examination of operating systems and applications installation, configuration, and maintenance, including client-server services, content management and deployment, server administration and management, and user/group management.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Wireless transmission basics, radio propagation, antennas, digital modulation, spread spectrum techniques, their applications. Design and testing Wi-Fi, WiMAX and microwave systems. Introduction to cellular technology.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science
